words.ENTRY: <H>palace</H><audio>palace.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a large house that is or was the home of a king or queen:</D> <X>the Buckingham Palace in London</X>

pardon (also pardon me) interjection(a very polite way of asking somebody to repeat what he/she has just said because you did not hear or understand it, or of saying that you are sorry for something that you have done)

<H>parent</H><audio>parent.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a mother or father:</D> <X>Most parents try to bring up their kids to be good citizens.</X><dot><X>My parents have been married for 18 years.</X>

<H>parentheses</H><audio>parentheses.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>plural</bracket><D>a pair of marks, ( ), that you put around extra information in a piece of writing or around part of a math problem:</D> <X>Add the numbers in parentheses first.</X>

<H>park</H><audio>park.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a piece of beautiful land with grass and trees, where anybody can go to walk, play, etc.:</D> <X>a walk in the park</X><dot><X>a park ranger</X><dot><X>Central Park</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket> (in compounds) <D>a large area of land that is open to the public and is used for special purposes:</D> <X>an amusement park</X><dot><X>an industrial park</X>

<H>partner</H><audio>partner.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>the person that you are married to or have a sexual relationship with</D> <NR>2.</NR><D>a person who takes part in activity with another or others</D>

partynouncountable (plural parties) a social occasion to which people are invited in order to eat, drink, and enjoy themselves: to have a partyto go to a partyWhen they moved into the new house, they had a housewarming party.a birthday/
dinner party

<H>passport</H><audio>passport.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an official document that identifies you and that you have to show when you enter or leave a country:</D> <X>Do you have to show your passport at the check-in counter?</X>

peoplenoun1.pluralmore than one person: How many people are coming to the party?He meets a lot of famous people in his job.2.countable (plural peoples) (formal) a nation, race, etc.: The Japanese are a hardworking people.the French-speaking peoples of the world

personnoun(pluralpeopleorpersons) 1.countablea man, woman or child: I would like to speak to the person in charge.2.singularone of the three types of pronoun in grammar. I/we are the first person, you is the second person and he/she/it/they are the third person.
phonenoun(informal) telephone: uncountableto make a phone callWhat's your phone number?You can buy the tickets by phone.countableto answer the phone
<H>phrase</H><audio>phrase.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a group of words that are used together:</D> <X>"First of all" and "a cup of coffee" are phrases.</X>

<H>picture</H><audio>picture.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a painting, drawing or photograph:</D> <X>Here's a picture of my brother.</X><dot><X>to draw/paint a picture</X><dot><X>Look at the picture on page 96 and describe what you see.</X>
<H>pilot</H><audio>pilot.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person who flies an aircraft:</D> <X>Philip is an airline pilot.</X>

<H>pineapple</H><audio>pineapple.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>a large juicy fruit that is yellow inside and has a thick brown skin with sharp points. Pineapples grow in hot regions:</D> <bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>pineapple juice</X>
<H>pizza</H><audio>pizza.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>a round flat piece of dough that is covered with tomatoes, cheese, onions, etc. and cooked in an oven</D>

placenouncountable1.a particular position or area: No one can be in two places at once.This is a good place for a picnic.Do you think that lamp is in the right place?2.a building, town, country, etc.: Monterey is a very beautiful place.3.(informal) the house, etc. where you live: Mark is having a party at his place tonight.

<H>plan</H><audio>plan.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an idea or arrangement for doing or achieving something in the future:</D> <X>Do you have any plans for the weekend?</X><dot><X>We usually make our vacation plans in January.</X>
<H>plane</H><audio>plane.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>airplane:</D> <X>We boarded the plane in Atlanta.</X><dot><X>a plane ticket</X>

<H>play</H><audio>play.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to do something to enjoy yourself; to have fun:</D> <X>They've been playing on the beach all day.</X><dot><X>He's playing with his new toy.</X><dot><X>Jane found a new friend to play with.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>to take part in a sport or game:</D> <X>"How about a game of chess?" "Sorry, but I don't know how to play."</X><dot><X>Who's playing in the game tonight?</X><dot><X>I play football on Saturdays.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>to make music with a musical instrument:</D> <X>My son's learning the piano. He plays very well.</X><dot><X>She played a few notes on the violin.</X><dot><X>Could you play that piece of music again?</X><NR>4.</NR><D>to turn on a record, tape, etc. so that it produces sound:</D> <X>Should I play the tape for you again?</X>

<H>player</H><audio>player.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a person who plays a game:</D> <X>a game for four players</X><dot><X>She's an excellent tennis player.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a person who plays a musical instrument:</D> <X>a piano player</X>

<H>please</H><audio>please.mp3</audio><PS>interjection</PS><D>(used as a polite way of making a request, an inquiry, or giving an order):</D> <X>Could you help me, please?</X><dot><X>Please don't touch the paintings.</X><dot><X>Sit down, please.</X><dot><X>Two cups of coffee, please.</X><dot><X>"Would you like something to drink?" "Yes, please."</X>

policenounpluralthe official organization whose job is to make sure that people obey the law, and to prevent and solve crime, etc.: Did you call the police when your car was stolen?
a police cara police report
police officer (also officer) nouncountablea person who is a member of the police

<H>polite</H><audio>polite.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>having or showing good manners, e.g. that you are helpful and thoughtful toward other people and do not say or do things that might upset them; not rude:</D> <X>The clerks in that store are always very helpful and polite.</X><dot><X>It's polite to say thank you.</X><dot><X>He gave me a polite smile.</X>

<H>poor</H><audio>poor.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>having very little money and a very low standard of living:</D> <X>The family was too poor to buy good food.</X><dot><X>We ought to help poorer countries.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>(used when you are showing that you feel sorry for somebody):</D> <X>That poor child lost both her parents.</X><dot><X>Poor Don! His car got stolen yesterday.</X>

<H>postcard</H><audio>postcard.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a card that you write a message on and send to somebody. Postcards often have a picture on one side and are usually sent without an envelope.</D> <X>Jane sent me a postcard from Rio.</X>

potatonouncountable, uncountable (plural potatoes) a round vegetable with a brown, yellow, or red skin. Potatoes are white or yellow inside. They grow under the ground on the roots of the potato plant: countableLinda peeled the potatoes for dinner.mashed potatoes with gravybaked potatoes (= baked in the oven inside their skins)uncountablepotato salad

<H>preposition</H><audio>preposition.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a word or phrase that is used before a noun or pronoun to show place, time, direction, etc.:</D> <X>"In," "for," "to," "out of," and "from" are all prepositions.</X>

pretty1adjective(prettier; prettiest) pleasant to look at; attractive: Rachel looks really pretty in that dress, doesn't she?very pretty material with yellow and blue flowers on itpretty2adverb(informal) 1.very, but not completely: You should wear a heavier coat. It's pretty cold outside.I'm pretty sure that Alex will agree.2.a little; fairly: It was a pretty good concert, but not the best.

<H>probably</H><audio>probably.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>almost certainly:</D> <X>I'll call you next week, probably on Wednesday.</X><dot><X>"Are you going to the mall with us?" "Probably not."</X>

<H>problem</H><audio>problem.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>a difficult situation that you must deal with:</D> <X>I'm facing a lot of big problems at work these days.</X><dot><X>to have financial problems</X><dot><X>There's a problem with the washing machine. It won't work.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a question that you have to solve by thinking about it:</D> <X>Vicky had ten physics problems to do for homework.</X>
<H>public</H><audio>public.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>provided for the use of people in general; not private:</D> <X>a public library</X><dot><X>a public park</X>
